TopicTitle: What's the highest mass you've ever put into Kerbin orbit with a single ship?

Articles.Content:
Further improved, or at least embiggened.

Now 17,500t and 753 parts on the pad, and just over 3000t in orbit.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Craft file: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/25339567/KSP%20Craft%20Files/Big%2052b.craft

I was working on a fuel rocket but I made the payload much to large. I'm still a beginner! Some of the things I'm seeing here are incredible. Kudos to Whackjob!

Edited June 8, 2014 by Mister Kerman

Delivered 2850t to orbit. With an SSTO booster.

The top part is an untested Eve lander with 10k m/s delta. (12 stage asparagus) Maybe it's enough?

I might try refueling the bottom to use as the transfer vehicle. But it has horrible lag, so that will be a chore.

http://i.imgur.com/FAjxGwq.png

Aww, that's cute.

Check out the ratio of launch to orbit on this mod design.

From a launch weight of 190 tons to 46 tons in orbit and 23 tons around Mun. It turned out to be an extremely efficient design. Orbital Berthas were used exclusively in this design.

I haven't found the limit on my "standard" launcher, though it will deliver 250t to Jool from Kerbin, with a little leftover for maneuvering, and 500t to a high parking orbit with a ton of fuel left.

I have an "ultra heavy" which doesn't really get used. Same design as the standard launcher, but double the mass. No idea how much it can lift.

I haven't found the limit on my "standard" launcher, though it will deliver 250t to Jool from Kerbin, with a little leftover for maneuvering, and 500t to a high parking orbit with a ton of fuel left.

I have an "ultra heavy" which doesn't really get used. Same design as the standard launcher, but double the mass. No idea how much it can lift.

...can I see pics and download links? Like, now. Actually, can you supply them 30 minutes ago?

Delivered 2850t to orbit. With an SSTO booster.

The top part is an untested Eve lander with 10k m/s delta. (12 stage asparagus) Maybe it's enough?

I might try refueling the bottom to use as the transfer vehicle. But it has horrible lag, so that will be a chore.

http://www.brianorca.com/ksp/screenshot151.png

http://www.brianorca.com/ksp/screenshot160.png

And here I thought the complaint with Asparagus was its too wide and ugly. Here is the answer, just stick the whole thing in orbit. Well done
I put a 580 ton freighter class ship in to a low orbit over kerbin
The Standord Torus from the BioDomes mod. 250t. Took a 6-way SLS onion to lift it. Now I want to see if I can lift 2 at once. God help me.

I think I have a new top weight.

Or not. Not sure.

I think I have a new top weight.

http://i.imgur.com/RRgDRq1.png

Or not. Not sure.

Oh god. Imagine what you could do with procedural parts and novapunch. *shudders*

Oh god. Imagine what you could do with procedural parts and novapunch. *shudders*

"blessed is he who displays exemplary gameplay through the power of stock" -book of Jeb (the psalm number is unreadable, smudged with something that smells like fuel)

KSP 0.23

18.2 kT total mass

678 parts

2.4 kT on LKO
